required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Conventional One-piece Versus Two-piece Magnet-retained Obturators
clinical_study.official_title: Patient Satisfaction of Conventional One-piece Versus Two-piece Magnet-retained Obturators for Patients With Complete Edentulism: A Crossover Study

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluation of patients' satisfaction with conventional one-piece obturators versus two pieces magnet -retained obturators in completely edentulous patient maxillectomy cases.

detailed_description.textblock: Ten completely edentulous participants with hemimaxillectomy (8 males and 2 females) were selected in an across over study. Participants received conventional obturator one piece and two pieces obturator connecting by magnet attachment in alternate periods (sequences A-B and B-A), and outcomes were assessed after 1 week,3 months, and 6 months Evaluation included Obturator Functioning Scale(OFS) and Oral Health Impact Profile for edentulous people (OHIP-EDENT ). One way ANOVA test and Multivariate analysis of variance with a general linear model with repeated measure was used to test the impact of the group, time, and order on each of the studied scores (Î±=.05).

primary_outcome.description: evaluation of satisfaction by Obturator Functioning Scale(OFS)

secondary_outcome.description: evaluation of satisfaction by Oral Health Impact Profile for edentulous people (OHIP-EDENT )

arm_group.description: Participants received conventional obturator one piece
two pieces obturators connected by magnet attachments

intervention.description: patient received two pieces obturator connecting by magnet attachment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- completely edentulous participants with hemimaxillectomy mouth opening is not less than 25 mm and intact soft palate
Exclusion Criteria:
- exposed to radiotherpy
